body_html:
Drive-by comments from my recent experience switching NWHC to NCWH:

  • tf.layers.conv2d doesn't support NCHW on CPU because of BiasOp. Seems weird that op is still being used, a+b should be sufficient
  • Tensorflow performance guide recommends recommends using tf.contrib.layers.batch_norm(x, fused=True, ...) which accepts data_format='NCWH'
  • When it doubt for notation, I think PyTorch should be followed, since API is super-clean

body:
Drive-by comments from my recent experience switching NWHC to NCWH:
- `tf.layers.conv2d` doesn't support NCHW on CPU because of BiasOp. Seems weird that op is still being used, a+b should be sufficient
- Tensorflow performance guide [recommends](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/b10f50ff15944badb7262a207f6628dfa52d6a9d/tensorflow/docs_src/performance/performance_guide.md) recommends using `tf.contrib.layers.batch_norm(x, fused=True, ...)` which accepts `data_format='NCWH'`
- When it doubt for notation, I think PyTorch should be followed, since API is super-clean
